More Notes: Small producers irrigating will have double the land value compared to rain-fed agriculture

The quantification reflects the increase in land value for irrigated farms compared to non-irrigated farms. Specifically, there is an expected increase of 21.6% in 2020 and 2050, and 20.5% in 2080 due to irrigation, with a standard deviation of 5.8 for irrigated land values. Uncertainty quantiles are not provided in this excerpt.
Non-irrigated land values are expected to decrease by 59.2% in 2020, 59.7% in 2050, and 60% in 2080. The variability (standard deviation) of land value for rain-fed agriculture is 57.8.

Mentions maize production losses of USD 2 billion per year until 2055 in Africa and Latin America, but does not provide results at a national scale for adaptation. The statement is attributed to Jones and Thornton (2003).
